title: Build a Flexible Logger
description: Create a logging method that accepts messages in multiple ways using C# 13 params.
instructions:
1. Create a method `LogMessages` that takes `params IEnumerable<string> messages`
2. Print each message with a timestamp prefix
3. Test with inline items, collection expression, and an existing list

hints.text: foreach works the same way on IEnumerable as on arrays

commonMistakes.mistake: Using params string[] instead of params IEnumerable<string>
commonMistakes.consequence: Callers must convert existing collections to arrays before passing them
commonMistakes.correction: C# 13 extends params to work with IEnumerable<T>. This allows callers to pass existing collections without conversion.
